column4: disable all security on the router and attempt connection. If it connects then your WEP key is wrong or you are selecting the wrong type of WEP
nope because it is working on other computers mac and windows.
any other ideas?
about what?
my problem
well i gathered you had a problem, can you please remind me was what I was after
I am trying to connect to wireless internet and this isn't working.  All it does is send me back to the Wireless Network Authentication box after I connect.
does it happen as another user?
only one this linux box but when I tried in windows it was disconnecting often
then make another, you can have multiple users on the Ubuntu system
only one
make a new user
are you sure that will help?
if the new user is ok then it is a bad setting in your current user some place. If the dialogue goes away as normal then the system is fine and your current user settings are bad somewhere
oh
if the same happens with the new user with clean vanilla settings then you have found a bug as the setting is not isolated to your one user
its called isolating the issue to see where things go wrong and go right so you can narrow down the possibilities until you know what is wrong
can't we try to work with one user?
if your profile is bad, no matter how many times you try you will always fail, you need to see if its settings or system which are bad
new users are free you know and they can be deleted once used
I didn't create the user it is the first one made by installation
yes I know, but you can add more
under administration you can add users there
